text:
Understanding dizziness. How to decipher this nonspecific symptom.
 Dizziness is a common but often nonspecific symptom.
 Through careful history taking and physical examination, primary care physicians can usually determine the type of sensation (vertigo or light-headedness) and its source.
 Although most causes of dizziness are benign, disorders of the central nervous system tend to be ominous and require immediate referral to a specialist.
